content:
Posted: April 2, 2016
Early Access Review
								While I haven't yet put in a lot of hours into the game, I will say that what's there is quite fun to play.It's an ideal game for anyone who likes Dwarf Fortress or Towns, as well as anyone who enjoys the whole "minimal input" genre of games. You can designate a plot to build on, then watch your little workers get to work. There's also resource management, combat, farming, and lots of other stuff that you indirectly have control over. Presentation wise, you can see that the creators of this game have put a lot of love into the detail and mechanics of the game. There's leveling up, skill progression, exploitation of resources, and all the fun stuff you'd expect from this genre of game.All in all, a worth it purchase.

number of helpful: 0 of 4 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 16, 2016
Early Access Review
								This is a good game. This game takes alot of ideas and throws it into a bowl without any part overpowering the others. It all blends really nice. Like a backrub from a high quality german stripper who, on her off time, met you at a coffer bar. She noticed you needed someone to talk to and came over with two Caramel Macchiatos. She sat down and asked how your day was, and you reply, "Stoneharth is difficult and I lost my favorite villager." Knowing how important it is that you keep all of them alive, she offered to help you play it. She sat you down and coached you through the hard parts. Told you to always work on military as well as how much food and wealth your village has. "Defences often save your life." She noted. You realized that at that moment, this game you've been playing is depper than you thought. The german stripper smiled, and left. You were too busy playing this game to ♥♥♥♥. That is alright. It is worth it.9.8/10 (Early Acess, it'll be 10 soon enough)

number of helpful: 19 of 44 people (43%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 8, 2015
Early Access Review
								The concept is fantastic, and there's a lot of potential in the game, but...There's far too many issues with its current state. Building custom buildings is near-impossible, the controls are often non-responsive, there's a nasty memory leak (this game should not require +6 gigs of RAM), and that's only the biggest problems. Workers that don't work, ladders and furniture that can't be deconstructed, etc. There's many small things that combine to make the game very hard to enjoy. Putting aside the bugs and building problems, the game is well designed. The progression of your minions is simple but effective, the resource harvesting likewise. My only quibble is that it takes a very long time to do anything with only a 2x speed option. I'd like the ability to go up to 8x at least.Given the strength of the underlying design, I look forward to playing the game more once it's had some bug-fixing done. However, I can only review it based on what it is now, so I cannot recommend this as is.

Early Access Review
								Stonehearth is a game of soldiers meets time management; you build a town and keep your inhabitants happy and defend them against enemies. The controls are simple enough to understand and do not require players to have an insane amount of dexterity to master the game. It's something of a sandbox designing villager's houses and towns.However the game meets a limit once you've established your colony and becomes tedious to defend against mobs. There are also times when I find myself sitting around doing nothing.

content:
Posted: February 25
Early Access Review
								I participated in the kickstart and got two copies from it because of my pledge. I played several alpha versions up to A20 and finally quit trying. If you watch the Kickstarter and earlier videos and then you play the game as it is now, it is like water and wine. The original seemed a lot more casual and about building a nice town and eventually castles with aspects of crafting, hunting and so on. However, the game grew in complexity so much that it is now not only too complex to be casual, but it is too complex for the developers to keep it up and follow up on the infinite bugs that it has. This game will never be complete IMHO because the development team forgot their basics and went for a too complex approach to be any good. When you get stuck over and over trying to build a single building, you will notice it won't go far.They should have left all the detail and minimalistic things and gone FIRST to the big game: place buildings, structures, etc... make enemies, little wars, little raids. Get the game WORKING, allow you to make any city or castle you wanted without worring if the door is aligned to the freaking wall or will even work. THEN elaborate the minimalistic things.Clearly, a team with no programming experience. Shame ...

content:
Posted: January 19
Early Access Review
								The bulk of their updates have been color swaps of already existing items. Two years on and the game still tanks with around 15+ hearthlings. Two years on and the game still doesn't really have a story. Two years on and the maps are still extremely small. Two years on and we've only gotten a handful of classes and new items. Two years on and we've only gotten a few new enemies. Two years on and the game is still plagued with bugs and errors, the same ones in many cases too. Two years on and the building tools still haven't really been improved. See the pattern? The development for this game is as slow as Interstellar Marines.Avoid, this is one of those Early Access games that will likely never be finished and they'll just rip the EA tagging off of it and abandon it. Regretful purchase. Most people I know who have it only put a few hours into this sandbox game and abandoned it. It was a great idea, but unfortunately it's the wrong developers. Play for 3 hours and you'll experience all that the game has to offer, which is pretty much the same as what it offered two years ago.

content:
Posted: June 13, 2015
Early Access Review
								As far as potential goes I think this game has quite a bit, and while I would not reccomend the game as it is due to the reasons below, in time it should reach the point of being a worthwhile game for the current cost. Which is another thing..this game right now at most should be 15-20, since its not a game with a lot of content and with some major fatal bugs. Currently most lot of the planned content is no where near being in which makes me question the pricing decision. Right now only 1/3rd of the intended jobs are in.During my five hours of gameplay I consantly ran into UI crashes and system failures, which would result in parts of the UI or game becoming unusable forcing you to reload. Twice now it has nearly crashed my pc to the point I was forced to do a false restart where the computer shuts the program down since you hit the power button but you then cancle the restart when it asks you to close your notepad. The game draws more ram then needed from your system causing sound glitches. Also combat in it can be frustraiting, having to use a badly designed party/designated area targeting system. And a warning, do NOT save when one of your characters is in direct combat, when you load the game takes a while to load the ui and seems to suddenly jump a minute or so ahead in combat, often instanly killing any non guard character without giving you the chance to react.

number of helpful: 1 of 12 people (8%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 23, 2016
Early Access Review
								Okay, this is fun. Heavily racist, but very fun with a mod. :-/ Danger zone maybe? Nah, heres how it is:It's a Banished/Minecraft clone essentially with the diffrence that exploring is limited to a smallish area and it's purely a town ownership and creation type game gathering resources etc with ikkle people/hearthlings, but it's enough to keep you hooked for endless hours once you realise that you can actually create your own building designs from literally the ground up. Forget the standard builds you can just select and place in the world for the Hearthlings to work for you, honestly, I recommend creating your own 10>20 person dining hall with a sleeping area on a second floor for the same amount in the beginning of this, then create walls etc.There are still some bugs that need ironing out, but for the price at the moment, it's a very enjoyable game and the devs are working hard on this continuously.Now, if you havent already fallen asleep reading this boring review I will get to the racism part...........We all like Multiculturism to a level where certain religions are NOT concerned, but if you choose "The Ascendancy" and want to have your town based on European based medievel type era castles etc you have to go through the randomise option a hundred times before you can get a full set of ginger, brown or black haired WHITE Hearthlings and 9/10 times they will all have rubbish stats, so you are forced to relive history as some kind of reinvention where all other nationalities were magically "transported" in like a bad star trek episode, where in the early year 1000's there were all colours and nationalities in old blighty and Europe. Yes I know, it's fiction with regard to stone monsters etc, but the castle walls and weapons etc are based on historical European designs.Not racist on my behalf, I want to recreate my tribe as per my historical descendancy!Now, however and the MAIN point here.........if you choose 'Rayyas Children' to play on either the Forest or Desert biomes and decide to import your white Hearthlings through that randomise button, you will spend eternity clicking and clicking to have a WIlliam Wallace white, brown haired hardcore dude as a hearthling because you can only play that sect as people with coloured skin! See where I am going here? ;-)Luckily there is a non dev mod available in the Steam store I eventually found, but really? You shouldnt have to use a mod to recreate a castle and medieval atmosphere! This is a game for the paying customer after all and everyone is scared of pointing this fact out due to being branded racist against colour of skin. This is racist against whites in my opinion!All that being said, with the mod it's a fantastic little gem this and worth under 20 quid in my opinion. A lot of work to be done ESPECIALLY with the system resource it requires even though its a tad basic (Needs optimisation in the code), but it's already worth that asking tag at the moment.Great work you racist bunch of devs, but mods shouldnt be needed! :-D

Half the time my people needed food, I made a farmer and set them to plant corn, he just sad there and continued to starve, same with the trapper(s). Not to mention the building system is very unfriendly at the moment. A. when you try to make your own building, the game almost breaks when you try to have a structure with more then one floor, Then if you somehow get past that, half the time when you tell your workers to build it, even if you have everything you need they will continue to sit there. One this game is fixed I have little doubt it could be one of the best games of its type. but now it is anything but that. Do Not get this game now unless you want to wait for updates

content:

Early Access Review
								Look promising and graphic look nice. Did not play much before refund. The reason is the building mechanic makes me frustrated. It is quite clunky and you cannot modify the building once builted. I think, building modification should be able since early development phase, especially this game is sales in alpha state (which is already 5 years). I think there are different between adding addition features and debug VS problem of game mechanic and functionality. Browsing through the developer website and forum, there is no mention about putting this feature in the game at any stage of development. Probably the game engine is at fault and building modification is not possible. Hope the developer or those with deep insight with this game can help answer my question. For now, I do not recommend this game due to the problem I mentioned.
